title: React Test Renderer doesn't render dynamically imported components
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
bug

**What is the current behavior?**
When rendering a component, which is dynamically loaded when it's needed, the child is not rendered with `toJSON()`.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem. Your bug will get fixed much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't have dependencies other than React. Paste the link to your JSFiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/) or CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new) example below:**
A simple component renders just fine with `react-test-renderer`.
```jsx
const renderer = create(<Component />);
console.log(renderer.toJSON() === null); // This will print false
```

However, when using `loadable-components` or `react-loadable` to load the component dynamically, the component doesn't render, and the `toJSON()` method returns null.
```jsx
import loadable from 'loadable-components';

const Component = loadable(() => import('./Component.jsx'));
const renderer = create(<Component />);
console.log(renderer.toJSON() === null); // This will print true
```

**What is the expected behavior?**
Renderer should render the whole tree or return a promise that can be `await`ed to wait for the result of the render.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
react-test-renderer: v16.5.2
